q_en: What raw materials are used by Skilled Sewers?
gt:
Sure! Let's dive into the materials used by the "Skilled Sewers" working group. Here's a breakdown of the original materials involved in their tasks:

| WIP Material ID | Original Material ID | Quantity |
|-----------------|----------------------|----------|
| **6**           | 5                    | 0.75     |
|                 | 1                    | 0.4      |
| **4**           | 3                    | 0.5      |
|                 | 14                   | 0.15     |
|                 | 13                   | 0.3      |
| **8**           | 7                    | 1.0      |
|                 | 9                    | 0.2      |
|                 | 5                    | 0.1      |
| **12**          | 11                   | 0.7      |
|                 | 1                    | 0.5      |
| **2**           | 1                    | 0.4      |
|                 | 11                   | 0.65     |
|                 | 3                    | 0.2      |
| **10**          | 9                    | 0.6      |
|                 | 1                    | 0.35     |
|                 | 13                   | 0.8      |

These are the original materials that are transformed into work-in-progress materials for the products handled by the "Skilled Sewers". If you have any more questions or need further details, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜„

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM working_group WHERE name = 'Skilled Sewers';
steps.description: Retrieve the working group ID for the group named "Skilled Sewers"

steps.sql: SELECT order_product_id FROM sewing_tasks WHERE working_group_id = '7';
steps.description: Retrieve the order_product IDs associated with sewing tasks assigned to "Skilled Sewers"

steps.sql: SELECT product_id FROM order_product WHERE id IN (8, 17, 18, 19, 23, 27, 28, 29);
steps.description: Retrieve the product IDs associated with the order_product IDs obtained in Step2

steps.sql: SELECT material_id FROM product_material WHERE product_id IN (2, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 14, 23);
steps.description: Retrieve the material IDs used by the products obtained in Step3

steps.sql: SELECT name FROM materials WHERE id IN (8, 12, 6, 2, 4, 10);
steps.description: Retrieve the names of the raw materials using the material IDs obtained in Step4

response:
Hello there! ðŸ˜„ Let's take a look at the raw materials used by the "Skilled Sewers" working group. Here's a handy table for you:

These are the materials that the talented "Skilled Sewers" team works with. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! ðŸ§µâœ¨
